title: Do students find online classes more interesting than traditional classes? If so, why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Online classes are those in which a student studies by the help of internet and we all know internet is a vast ocean of knowledge. The trend of online classes has shown a ‘J curve’ especially during lockdown due to COVID19. Students have become more and more inclined towards the online mode of education, one possible reason for this inclination could be availability of time to explore different courses and classes while sitting at home but the other majorly important reason for this shift is ‘interest’. The concept of online classes, though already existed in Indian education system but still the majorly accepted mode of teaching was traditional classroom teaching. Now when students have interacted enough and experienced the perks of online classes they surely would have found online classes more interesting than traditional classes. A recent study has shown 77% of educators believe that online classes are just as good as traditional classes, if not better and nearly 70% of all students claim online instruction to be as good as or better than in a traditional classroom setting. Definitely online classes may be new for some of the students but considering the recent scenario in covid19 pandemic when all schools,colleges and other educational institutions are shut. Students are left with only one option to educate themselves, that is through online classes. The so far response of both students and teaches about online classes have proved to be a good news for the Indian education system. Gradually with time, by the help of online classes the loss of students will get compensated also it is believed, by that time students will not only become educated but also become technologically advanced.

I can say a “Yes” if its is a one to one class or say very few members where the teacher can engaging teach all the participants. This is the case especially in the case of Children under 13. On the other hand, for the High school, with a creative and attractive content with animated content, quizzes and polls created online, learning becomes less laborious with lesser writing, new ways of learning and easing the effort. For aspiring learners like the ones preparing for competitive exams like Olympiads, NTSE, JEE/NEET , instant doubt clarification with young tutors who are not available in front of them gives them the comfort zone of asking all their doubts without hesitation and getting them clarified. So, it is the students who have the self motivation and aspiration who are enjoying these online classes otherwise it should be a really appealing and interesting content to keep them captivated else online classes aren't that interesting to them at all.

Some may like it or some may not. It depends on various factors to find out which type of teaching method the student likes. Some students like the traditional classes because it makes the environment for themselves to learn, understand and they can’t focus while learning at their home. Also, they feels more comfortable and experiences well due to the real face-to-face interaction with the teachers and can ask question directly from the teacher (although, this can be done online but they don’t feel that much comfortable while learning online). On the other hand, some students may like the new online classes initiative more interesting as they are at their home feeling more comfortable (which they can’t feel in classes due to various reasons for ex: bullying) to learn and interact with the teacher and class, virtually. Also, the student may tend to gain more from the teacher due to its comfortableness and easiness at home environment. . . So it depends from student to student. . . . PS!

One of the important reasons behind more interest in online classes is that they are convenient. Children like to relax and what is better than to study in their comfort zone? Moreover, with so many digital tools like whiteboard learning, animated videos, and communication options, children find online learning fun and interactive. Online classes keep the students engaged. The teacher interacts with everyone and has an eye on everybody. This provides undivided attention to each student, along with answers to every student’s doubts. In a traditional classroom set up, students encounter more distractions. A teacher cannot focus on all the children separately, but online learning removes such restrictions. Even if a student was unable to learn well in his online class, he can discuss it with the teacher and arrange for another class. If the teacher is available for more extended hours, it becomes easier for the student to clarify his doubts as and when he faces them.

Keeping the doors of learning open, online education is proving to be very helpful in this Covid-19 world where all the educational institutions are forced to shut with almost 1.2 billion of the world’s students not attending school. With the technological revolution and innovative methods of E-learning, education is made available to the doorstep of children, eliminating the need for commuting from one place to another or following a rigid schedule, and providing a comfortable environment where learning is possible in pyjamas. Most importantly, online learning is a greener option, offering diverse material such as videos, photos, e-books and online quizzes, plummeting the need of physical textbooks. In a space as vast and wide as the internet, there are infinite skills and subjects to teach and learn. Some of the renowned ed-techs like BYJU’S, Unacademy, Udemy, edX, Khan Academy, Coursera etc. are offering some selective free courses (in collaboration with various universities and colleges) which proved to be very qualitative in the lockdown. Needless to say, traditional learning will always remain our first preference. However, with the unique advantage of serving varied interests of students on a single dashboard, online learning is stoking as well.  Image Source: Google Team Learnweel.
